intro: Rumohra nigrospinosa, commonly known as the black-spined sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, spiny bracts and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Rumohra nigrospinosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
